definition: Sun Li (1913-2002), novelist
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
plow

sentences.english: The first one probes into intellectual psychology of Sun li in liberated area of period mainly.
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要探讨孙犁在解放区时期的知识分子心态。

sentences.english: Sun Li is a proletarian writer.
sentences.chinese: 孙犁是一位无产阶级作家。

sentences.english: The point of Sun Li's proposition in literature is humanism.
sentences.chinese: 孙犁的“为人生”文学主张的核心是人道主义。

sentences.english: Sun Li regards true as literature's life.
sentences.chinese: 孙犁把“真”当做文学的生命。

sentences.english: Sun Li is a well-recognized Chinese pioneering editor with the following remarkable insights.
sentences.chinese: 孙犁是一位卓有成绩的，具有独到见解的编辑家。

sentences.english: Sun Li is a contemporary writer of local color who masters various literary styles.
sentences.chinese: 孙犁是当代文坛上精通各种文学样式的乡土作家。

definition: Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Zhao Shuli (1906-1970), proletarian novelist
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist

definition: Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Ye Shengtao (1894-1988), writer and editor, known esp. for children's books
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Cao Yu (1910-1997), PRC dramatist
Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
Ji Xianlin (1911-2009), Chinese linguist and Indologist
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Yao Xueyin (1910-1999), PRC novelist, author of historical novel Li Zicheng 李自成
